laboratory_examinations.findings: Metabolically active enlarged mediastinal and infrahilar lymph nodes, suspected for metastatic disease.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The thoracic lesions remained stable for 3 years.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No increase of serum normetanephrine, metanephrine, or 3-methoxytyramine concentrations was detected.
No residual disease initially, later found two lesions suggestive of local recurrence and vagal PGL.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Slight growth of both HNPGLs over time.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Confirmed the diagnosis of metastatic PGL.
Showed increased metabolic activity in all tumor locations and an additional detected sclerotic bone lesion in the L5 vertebra.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Attributed to stable disease over five years.

laboratory_examinations.date: 5 years after diagnosis of metastatic disease
laboratory_examinations.findings: Showed a significant decrease in metabolic activity of multiple metastatic lesions and complete response at the level of L5.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated stabilization and response to treatment.
